title.narrative: Emergency life-saving assistance for water crisis affected population in Deir Ez

description.narrative: 1. Multi -purpose cash assistance to most vulnerable Households (HHs) in water crisis affected rural areas of Deir ez Zor. Oxfam will provide 6 rounds of unconditional multipurpose cash transfers (211,000 SYP/ 84.4 USD per tranche) to 375 HHs (2,625 individuals) in Khsham community, at least 30% of which will be Female Headed Households (FHHs). This contributes to Food Security and Agriculture (FSA) Objective 1 of Humanitarian Response Plan (HRP) 2021. Post -distribution surveys from Oxfam's previous cash distributions indicate that most of recipients use cash to buy food and medicines. 2. Rehabilitation and immediate response to mitigate the impact of Euphrates river lowering Oxfam will focus on cleaning, spot rehabilitation and strengthening the existing capacity of irrigation system for water intake. Oxfam will also introduce resilience techniques while implementing emergency activities so that communities are prepared for any drought cycle.150,000 persons will benefit from this intervention in all villages of Deir ez Zor & Al Mayadin districts. This activity contributes to FSA Objective 2 and it contributes to the water crisis response plan. 3. Immediate spot rehabilitation of drinking water supply system to mitigate the impact of Euphrates river lowering and improve the access of water Oxfam will supply and install 3 raw water pumping sets size 80 m3/h flow and of 60m head each, at Marrat pumping station site connecting to Mazloom pumping station to restore its pumping capacity to the station. Most of the drinking water pumping and purification stations' intakes along the Euphrates riverbanks had significantly reduced. This will be addressed through lengthening the suction pipes and replacing the damaged/deteriorated ones. The proposed actions are in line with the SO1 of HRP 2021. 4.Cleaning the sanitary sewer main outlets at the riverbank to reduce pollution and improve wastewater dilution factor. Oxfam will intervene to reduce pollution and improve wastewater
